review: My entire entertainment center now revolves around my Chromecast.I had bought a smart tv that had apps built in, but it became quickly apparent that the tv manufacturer was not interested in keeping the software up to date or expanding their offerings in terms of services.  This is where the Chromecast is brilliant - the providers themselves are interested in getting on your tv and they'll keep their software up to date on your mobile devices.  Things like Netflix, Pandora, Rdio work fantastically with the Chromecast.Would love to see Amazon finally allow Amazon Prime Video work on Chromecast, though.
author: Brian O'Connor

review: This is a neat little device.  It's such a different approach to online streaming than the alternatives like Roku and Amazon Fire TV.  I didn't really research it before I got it, I just wanted to try it out so I had no idea that that it didn't just have apps on it that you play from like every other device.  That has it's ups and downs for me.  It's nice that I can cast any tab from Chrome right to it.  But it's not so great that I have to rely on another device to provide the apps like Vudu or Netflix or WatchESPN to then Cast them to this device.  I'd prefer an approach where the apps are on the device so you can use them directly from the device. But it then had another option for casting Chrome Tabs or mirroring your phone screen with Android 5.0.
